culinary.name: Keto Lavender Lemon Shortbread Cookies
culinary.description: Delicate buttery keto cookies infused with aromatic lavender and bright lemon zest. Sugar-free, gluten-free, and perfect for tea time.
ingredients: 1/2 cup erythritol or monk fruit sweetener
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
In a bowl, whisk together almond flour, coconut flour, sweetener, salt, and lavender.
In a large bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Mix in lemon zest and vanilla extract.
Gradually add dry ingredients to butter mixture until just combined.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place on parchment-lined baking sheet.
Flatten each ball slightly with a fork.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until edges are lightly golden.
Cool on wire rack completely before serving.
tips: Use culinary lavender, not ornamental varieties
Don't overbake - cookies should be pale
Store in airtight container for up to 1 week
Almond flour creates a tender, delicate texture

culinary.name: Mediterranean Herb-Crusted Salmon
culinary.description: Fresh salmon fillets topped with a fragrant crust of fresh herbs, garlic, and lemon. A healthy and flavorful dinner ready in 30 minutes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat salmon fillets dry and season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, combine all herbs, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and zest.
Place salmon on a lined baking sheet.
Spread herb mixture evenly over each fillet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon flakes easily.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges.
tips: Don't overcook - salmon should be slightly pink in center
Can substitute with other firm fish like halibut
Pairs well with roasted vegetables or quinoa

culinary.name: Keto Rosemary and Sea Salt Focaccia
culinary.description: Low-carb Italian-style flatbread topped with fresh rosemary, coarse sea salt, and olive oil. Gluten-free and keto-friendly.
ingredients: 1/4 cup olive oil, plus extra for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix almond flour, psyllium husk, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, olive oil, warm water, and vinegar.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, mix well. Let stand 5 minutes to thicken.
Spread dough in oiled 9x13 inch pan, about 1/2 inch thick.
Dimple surface with fingers, drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with rosemary and sea salt.
Bake 20-25 minutes until golden and firm.
Cool slightly before cutting.
tips: Psyllium husk gives bread-like texture
Don't skip the vinegar - it helps with rise
Can add olives or sun-dried tomatoes
Best served warm, stores well for 3 days

culinary.name: Keto Mint and Cauliflower Soup
culinary.description: A vibrant green low-carb soup combining cauliflower with fresh mint. Light, refreshing, and perfect for any season.
ingredients: 4 cups bone broth or vegetable broth
1/2 cup heavy cream or coconut cream
Optional: 1 cup spinach for extra greens
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Sauté onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Add broth and bring to a boil.
Add cauliflower and simmer 10-12 minutes until tender.
Add spinach if using, cook 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and add mint and parsley.
Blend until smooth using immersion blender.
Stir in cream, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot or chilled, garnished with mint.
tips: Can be served hot or cold
For dairy-free, use coconut cream
Freezes well for up to 3 months
Add MCT oil for extra healthy fats

culinary.name: Classic Keto Basil Pesto with Pine Nuts
culinary.description: Traditional Genovese pesto made with fresh basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan. Naturally keto and gluten-free, perfect for zucchini noodles or grilled vegetables.
ingredients: Optional: 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast for extra umami
instructions: Toast pine nuts in dry pan until golden, let cool.
In food processor, combine basil, pine nuts, and garlic.
Pulse until coarsely chopped.
Add Parmesan (and nutritional yeast if using) and pulse again.
With processor running, slowly drizzle in olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Use immediately or store with thin layer of oil on top.
tips: Blanch basil for brighter green color
Can substitute walnuts or almonds for pine nuts
Freeze in ice cube trays for easy portions
Serve over zucchini noodles or shirataki pasta for keto meal

remedies.name: Calming Chamomile Sleep Tea
remedies.description: A soothing bedtime tea blend that promotes relaxation and restful sleep. Perfect for winding down after a stressful day.
ingredients: Stevia or monk fruit sweetener to taste (optional)
instructions: Combine all dried herbs in a tea infuser or teapot.
Pour boiling water over herbs.
Cover and steep for 10 minutes.
Strain and add honey if desired.
Drink 30-60 minutes before bedtime.
Sweeten with stevia or monk fruit if desired.
precautions: Avoid if allergic to daisy family plants
tips: Make a larger batch and store in the refrigerator
Can be enjoyed iced in summer
Add a splash of warm milk for extra comfort

remedies.name: Ginger Honey Cough Syrup
remedies.description: A natural cough syrup combining the soothing properties of honey with the warming, anti-inflammatory effects of ginger and lemon.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sugar-free honey substitute (like Lakanto) or 1/4 cup erythritol
instructions: In a saucepan, combine ginger, thyme, and water.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 15 minutes.
Strain out solids, pressing to extract liquid.
Let cool to warm temperature.
Stir in sweetener, glycerin, and lemon juice until well combined.
Add cayenne if using for extra throat-soothing power.
Store in a glass jar in refrigerator.
remedies.dosage: Adults: 1-2 tablespoons every 4 hours as needed. Children over 1: 1 teaspoon
precautions: Safe for diabetics with sugar-free sweetener
Start with small doses to test tolerance
tips: Can add cinnamon or cloves for flavor
Take straight or mix in warm water
Also works as a preventive during cold season

remedies.name: Peppermint Digestive Tincture
remedies.description: A concentrated herbal extract to relieve digestive discomfort, gas, and bloating. Take before or after meals for best results.
instructions: Combine all herbs in a clean glass jar.
Pour alcohol over herbs, ensuring they're covered by 2 inches.
Seal jar tightly and label with date.
Store in a cool, dark place for 4-6 weeks.
Shake jar daily for first 2 weeks.
Strain through cheesecloth, squeezing out liquid.
Store in dark glass dropper bottles.
Label with ingredients and date.
remedies.dosage: 20-30 drops in water, 15 minutes before meals
precautions: Contains alcohol - not for children or those avoiding alcohol
May worsen acid reflux in some people
Start with smaller dose to test tolerance
tips: Can use apple cider vinegar instead of alcohol
Add to sparkling water for a digestive mocktail
Keep a small bottle in your purse for dining out

remedies.name: Calendula Healing Salve
remedies.description: A gentle, all-purpose healing salve for cuts, scrapes, dry skin, and minor irritations. Safe for the whole family.
ingredients: 1 cup olive oil or sweet almond oil
instructions: Infuse herbs in oil using slow method: combine in jar, let sit 2 weeks, shaking daily.
Or quick method: gently heat herbs and oil in double boiler for 2 hours.
Strain oil through cheesecloth, pressing out all liquid.
In double boiler, melt beeswax into infused oil.
Remove from heat, add essential oil and vitamin E if using.
Pour into small jars or tins while liquid.
Let cool completely before using.
Label with ingredients and date.
remedies.usage: Apply small amount to affected area 2-3 times daily
precautions: Do not use on deep wounds
Test on small area first for allergies
remedies.shelfLife: 1 year when stored in cool, dry place
tips: Add plantain for extra healing power
Use coconut oil for antifungal properties
Makes great gifts in small tins

remedies.name: Elderberry Immune Support Syrup
remedies.description: A delicious immune-boosting syrup packed with antioxidants. Take daily during cold and flu season for prevention.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sugar-free honey substitute or 1/4 cup erythritol
instructions: Combine elderberries, water, ginger, cinnamon, and cloves in saucepan.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 45 minutes.
Liquid should reduce by about half.
Strain through fine mesh, pressing berries to extract liquid.
Let cool to lukewarm temperature.
Stir in sweetener and glycerin until dissolved.
Pour into glass jar and refrigerate.
Shake before each use.
remedies.dosage: Prevention: 1 tbsp daily. Active illness: 1 tbsp every 2-3 hours
precautions: Raw elderberries are toxic - must be cooked
tips: Can freeze in ice cube trays for single doses
Add to sparkling water for immune-boosting soda
Double batch and share with friends

remedies.name: Anti-Inflammatory Golden Milk
remedies.description: A warming, anti-inflammatory drink based on ancient Ayurvedic tradition. Perfect for joint pain, inflammation, or general wellness.
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond or coconut milk
Pinch of black pepper (essential for absorption)
1 teaspoon coconut oil or MCT oil
Stevia or monk fruit sweetener to taste
Optional: 1 tablespoon collagen powder for protein
instructions: In a small saucepan, whisk together milk and all spices.
Add coconut oil or ghee.
Heat over medium heat, whisking frequently.
Bring to a simmer but don't boil.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Add sweetener to taste.
Add collagen powder if using and whisk well.
Strain if desired for smoother texture.
Enjoy warm, preferably before bed.
remedies.dosage: 1 cup daily, best taken in evening
precautions: Start with less turmeric if new to it
Can stain - be careful with clothing
tips: Make a batch of spice mix for convenience
Add vanilla extract for extra flavor
Can be enjoyed iced in summer
MCT oil provides quick energy on keto
